main event: A civilian spotted a circular object appearing like a bright star that moved against the background, showing intermittent pulsation and a vertical long yellow/white trail extending at least two feet in duration.
interesting points: The object maneuvered, moving south, then west, then back north, before disappearing below the horizon.
The sighting lasted for about 2 minutes.
The object's movement and appearance was inconsistent with a meteor sighting.
Two other civilian witnesses, engineers, also observed the object.
Weather conditions at the time included a subsidence inversion at the altitude estimated for the object.
sighted object: Circular object appearing like a bright star
